channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Kim Heckler, A Woman of Firsts
channel.desc: Kimberly Heckler talks about her biography of her mother-in-law, Margaret Heckler, a trailblazing Republican member of Congress from Massachusetts (1967-83), who later served as HHS Secretary and Ambassador to Ireland under President Reagan.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Lectures in History
channel.desc: Tulane University history professor Keely Smith discusses Native American alliances during the Revolutionary War and how various tribes were viewed by the U.S. government, and American society, during the early Republic.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: SC AHTV LCV Ogden, UT 'Promontory Summit at the Golden Spike National Historic Site
channel.desc: David Kilton, National Park Service Ranger, visits Promontory Summit, the site where the golden spike was struck completing construction on the Transcontinental Railroad on May 10, 1869.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This 1961 Information Agency film covers the first years of construction of the Glen Canyon dam on the Colorado River in northern Arizona.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: The Presidency
channel.desc: White House Historical Association historian Lina Mann talks about Elizabeth Keckley - a popular Washington, D.C. dressmaker & former slave - who was a confidante of first lady Mary Lincoln.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Lectures in History
channel.desc: Tulane University history professor Keely Smith discusses Native American alliances during the Revolutionary War and how various tribes were viewed by the U.S. government, and American society, during the early Republic.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: 80th Anniversary of 1945 Victory in Europe Day
channel.desc: World War II veterans and representatives from European embassies observe the 80th anniversary of the May 8, 1945, surrender of Nazi Germany to the Allies, which ended World War II in Europe.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: FDR's 1936 Ford Phaeton
channel.desc: The Franklin D. Roosevelt Presidential Library & Museum offers a glimpse at the specially modified Ford Phaeton car that allowed a disabled FDR to drive himself.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Jennie Jerome Churchill & Sara Delano Roosevelt
channel.desc: The mothers of British Prime Minister Winston Churchill, American Jennie Jerome, and of Franklin Delano Roosevelt, Sara Delano, are the subjects of a conversation about their lives and considerable influence.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Remembering George Washington's Mother
channel.desc: American University professor Kate Haulman talks about how George Washington's mother, Mary Ball Washington, is remembered after the Revolutionary War era.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: The Civil War
channel.desc: Historians discuss the Civil War at the Gettysburg College Civil War Institute's 2024 annual conference in Gettysburg, Pennsylvania.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: The Civil War
channel.desc: Historians discuss the Civil War at the Gettysburg College Civil War Institute's 2024 annual conference in Gettysburg, Pa.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This documentary details the history of the virus that causes measles and the development of the measles vaccine in the 1950s and early 1960s.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: History of Civil Service
channel.desc: Joseph McCartin, Margaret Rung and Eric Yellin discuss the history of civil service and government workers.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: FDR's 1936 Ford Phaeton
channel.desc: The Franklin D. Roosevelt Presidential Library & Museum offers a glimpse at the specially modified Ford Phaeton car that allowed a disabled FDR to drive himself.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Technology & The Great War
channel.desc: Military history professor Richard Faulkner discusses the technological changes that occurred in the late 19th and early 20th centuries that led to the development of new weapons deployed during World War I.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Thomas Maier, The Invisible Spy
channel.desc: Investigative reporter Thomas Maier profiles former NFL football player and World War II spy Ernest Cuneo, and his connection to British Prime Minister Winston Churchill's New York-based spy ring during the war.
